comments:
We have some code which updates webservices.xml from a job. Using a slightly
newer driver than M5, I run into the following exception quite often which
prevents us from creating two J2EE Web services in the same module:

It looks like had an editor opened on a resource being modified by your builder.
 What kind of editor was it?
I'm guessing it was either a text editor in Eclipse or one outside (UltraEdit).

Dropping to major as this problem only seems to occur when an editor is opened
on the webservices.xml file while the update is occurring.

I'm reassigning to sse component, David - let me know if we are doing something
wrong?

from the stack trace, I think this is only occuring if the webservices.xml is
open in the basic eclipse text editor. I do not think this will occur if opened
in our WTP XML editor. Yen, are you set up to easily confirm that? 

If that is the case, not sure what the fix will be, but will investigate.

Perhaps sse.ui could register a file buffer document setup participant that sets
the execution context on StructuredDocuments?  When the UI is open, this should
be valid until the document's text file buffer is fully disconnected.

Not sure I understand your comment Nitin. From a purely model side, we do not
know when the UI context should be set ... do we? 

I'm "deferring" with one past .7, since I think any change would be kind of
large, and even though Yan hasn't confirmed it, I think this only occurs for
'text' editor, not any of our structured editors (since they do know to set the
UI context). We also need to get this problem solved at the base level, where it
exists ... we should send them a patch :)
oh, marking as "p4" to indicated there is a good reason to defer.

This is definitely happening with the text editor. It also happens with the
XML editor too:

Excellent diagnostics, Yen. Thanks. 

We should be able to easily and safely fix the TableTree refresh method to 
be sure its on a UI thread and if not post an asynch runnable to the Display
thread. 

The pure text editor case will have to wait, though. 

Amy ... would you like a crack at this one?

Created an attachment (id=24976)
EAR containing webservices.xml

thanks for the ear file.  could i also get a simple scenario to reproduce?
thanks.

Thanks to Amy for walking me through the fix for this bug. 
I've committed fix to head, Amy will confirm with original scenerio, 
and, assuming fixed, will release for 7/20 I-build (RC2).
i have confirmed the original scenario is fixed.
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee.  If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
